messages.message:
Hi, i’ve got a use case with Citi at the moment, and i’m not sure of the best way to solve it with our current tooling. I need to get back to Citi pretty quickly on this.

The below document is quite long, and has lots of different Articles. Each article has a chunk of natural language in it. For All articles I need a list of the investment restrictions extracted. For example ‘Max 5% NAV per issuer’ could be a restriction. Because of the long doc problem I can’t ask ‘Get me all the restrictions from each article out of the whole document’

I thought I could break the document up by the Article Title and then prompt for each article individually. I can’t get this to work well, if I ask ‘In Article 1 list all investment restrictions’ it gets the information from all over the document.

What is the best way to approach a problem like this?
@lydia I think this could be an example where I want to interact with an LLM directly once we’ve broken the document down into sections, by passing in each article with the prompt.
Lee this thread may help you, we came across the same issue: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1689869306192099

I don’t have any advice for right now (maybe other than manually chopping down the pdf). Our code currently isn’t optimized for extracting many things across a long document.

But if you don’t mind I’ll save this document as an example for when I work on “multi-occurrence extraction” https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-360
Agent based converse does ok when asked for one article at a time, but this isn’t released yet either
